meanings.definition: To focus or concentrate on something before it happens or is needed.
meanings.sent1: She was prefocussing on her presentation before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The students were prefocussing on their upcoming exams.
meanings.sent3: He was prefocussing so intensely that he forgot about lunch.
meanings.sent4: Prefocussing on the finish line, she sprinted towards it with determination.
meanings.sent5: Prefocussing on his goal, he worked tirelessly to achieve it.

meanings.definition: The act of adjusting a camera or lens to focus on a subject before taking a picture.
meanings.sent1: The prefocussing of the camera ensured a clear shot of the bird.
meanings.sent2: Before capturing the sunset, he did the prefocussing of his camera.
meanings.sent3: The prefocussing of the lens made the photographer look like a professional.
meanings.sent4: With precise prefocussing, the photographer captured the beauty of the flower.
meanings.sent5: The prefocussing of the camera lens brought out the details in the landscape.
